Description: Two fragments of a narrow, undyed and dark brown cotton and goat hair woven tape binding consisting of 3 cotton warps alternating with 2 of goat hair and 17 fragments of goat hair cord, with the cotton warps now missing. The selvedge is plain and the weave is warp-face and plain. The cotton yarns consist of 3 elements 's'-spun then 'z'-plied and the goat hair yarns consist of 2 elements 'z'-spun and 'z'-plied. On one woven fragment a second textile or undyed cotton is attached to one end. There is a knot in the hair strands.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p. 62)
Condition: Fair. The cotton element has deteriorated and is missing from most of the binding fragments.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.105B (excavation object cat. no.)
